channel.title: The Travel Student
channel.description: Your personal guide for free travel

item.title: 7 Best Credit Cards for College Students
item.dc:creator: Devesh
item.description:
Your credit score can impact your ability to rent an apartment, take a car loan or a student loan. The better credit score you have the better interest rates you will get for your loans. That's why building credit from an early age is important and what's better than starting as a college student.

Check the best credit cards for students according to their best features.
item.content:encoded:
Why do student need Credit Cards?

Your credit score can impact your ability to rent an apartment, take a car loan or a student loan. The better credit score you have the better interest rates you will get for your loans. That's why building credit from an early age is important and what's better than starting as a college student.
If you want to get started with credit while you're in college, a student credit card is what you should be looking for. You can get a Student credit card or a normal credit depending on your credit history.


Great no annual fee cards.


How do I rank a Credit cards for Students?

The first assumption I make is assuming a no-credit history or very limited credit history. Almost all the cards for students have same benefits but there are few things which make them unique and easy to get approve:

  • Annual Fee: I would recommend to get a no annual fee card; as a student you don't need to pay for any unwanted fee. I have not included any card with an annual fee.
  • Rewards: One of the main reasons of getting credit cards is for its rewards and this is one main reasons to differentiate among cards. Your'e cards can reward you with cashback or points on eligibe purchases.
  • APR (Introductory APR): APR is the interest that you pay if you don't pay your credit card balance in full at the end of your statement. There are many credit cards that offer you 0% Introductory APR for first 12-21 months.
  • Acceptance Rate: Most college students have limited experience with credit history and with credit cards, so acceptance rate matters for students. There is no real number for acceptance rates, but from data points and customer interactions we get to know that which cards are easier to get. Chase cards are hard to get as your first credit card but BOFA, Capital One and Discover cards are really easy to get even without any credit history.
  • Sign up bonus: Sign up bonuses are bonus offers when you get as a welcome gift for applying and getting approved for the credit card.

Seven of the best Credit Cards:

  1. Discover it® for Student cards
    • Easiest to get approved for (for anyone who is starting their credit history).
    • $20 bonush cashback every year for good grades (< 3.0 GPA) for up to the next 5 years.
    • Cashback Rewards: 5% cash back in rotating categories plus, unlimited 1% cash back on all other purchases.
    • At the end of your first year, all the cash back you've earned on your student card, Discover will match every bit of it.

    Discover's Student Card.

  2. Journey® Student Rewards from Capital One®
    • Second easiest card to get.
    • Earn 1% cash back on all your purchases. Pay on time to boost your cash back to a total of 1.25% for that month.
    • Get access to a higher credit line with Credit Steps after making your first 5 monthly payments on time.
    • No Foreign Transaction Fees.

    Capital One's Student Journey Rewards Card.

  3. Discover it® Chrome for Student cards

    4. Almost similar to other Discover Card, just a small change on cashback rewards, if you dine in a lot outside and fill up your tank regularly go for this one.

    • Easiest to get approved for (for anyone who is starting their credit history).
    • $20 bonush cashback every year for good grades (< 3.0 GPA) for up to the next 5 years.
    • Cashback Rewards: Earn 2% at gas stations and restaurants on up to $1,000 in combined purchases each quarter plus, unlimited 1% cash back on all other purchases.
    • At the end of your first year, all the cash back you've earned on your student card, Discover will match every bit of it.

  4. Wells Fargo Cash Back College Card
    • Designed for Students
    • Cellular Telephone Protection: Pay your monthly cellular telephone bill with your eligible Wells Fargo Consumer Credit Card and you'll get up to $600 protection (subject to a $25 deductible).
    • 3% cash rewards on gas, grocery, drugstore for first 6 months, 1% cash rewards on virtually all other net purchases.
    • 0.00% introductory APR for 6 months.

    Cell Phone Protection is great feature on this card.

  5. BankAmericard Cash Rewards™ for Students
    • $100 Sign up bonus if you spend $500 in first 3 months.
    • Introductory 0% APR for your first 12 billing cycles for purchases, and for any balance transfers made within 60 days of opening your account.
    • 1% cash back on every purchase, 2% at grocery stores and wholesale clubs and 3% on gas for the first $2,500 in combined grocery/wholesale club/gas purchases each quarter.
    • As a Bank of America customer, you can get a 10% customer bonus every time you redeem your cash back into a Bank of America® checking or savings account.
    • My First Credit card, I will recommend to apply it in branch. Check out this post for more details

    Citi's special card for Students.

  6. Citi ThankYou® Preferred Card for College Students
    • 0% Intro APR for 7 months
    • Sign-up bonus of 2,500 points after you spend $500 within three months of opening the account.
    • You can earn two points for each dollar spent on dining or entertainment, and one point for every dollar spent elsewhere.

    Great offer on a no annual fee card.

  7. Chase Freedom Unlimited
    • The best card I believe among all but its not as easy to get and that is why it comes down on my list. Apply if you have some credit history like having one card for 3 months or more.
    • EARN A $150 BONUS after you spend $500 on purchases in your first 3 months from account opening.
    • EARN A $25 BONUS when you add your first authorized user and make your first purchase within this same 3-month period.
    • Earn 1.5x Cashback/UR Points on all the purchases made on the card.
    • 0% Intro APR for 15 months on purchases and balance transfers.

My Verdict:

The best card for a student or someone with no credit history at all is Discover It Card. If you have any kind of history, you should surely go with Chase Freedom Unlimited. Frankly it is one of the best no annual fee card. To know more about applying for your first credit card, Check out this post for more details.

item.title: The battle of the best
item.dc:creator: Devesh
item.description:
With American Express making changes to its Platinum Card now makes all the top three high end credit card companies to make changes to its top product in the last 1 year. Today I am trying to evaluate which one is the best card among the best.

Here is the detailed overview of all the three big cards and which is the best?
item.content:encoded:
With American Express making changes to its Platinum Card now makes all the top three high end credit card companies to make changes to its top product in the last 1 year. Today I am trying to evaluate which one is the best card among the best.

Which cards are being evaluated?

  • Chase Sapphire Reserve
  • Platinum Card by American Express
  • Citi Prestige Card

The battle of the best.

Annual Fee vs Earning?

The annual fees of the top cards is $450 for CSR and Prestige whereas annual fee of Platinum has been increased to $550. All three cards have different bonus categories.

Chase Sapphire Reserve
AMEX Platinum Card
Citi Prestige
Annual Fee
$450
$550
$450
Airfare & Hotels
3x (Includes all travel purchases)
5x (purchased through airlines/ Amex portal)
3x (Includes all travel purchases)
Dining
3x
1x
2x
Entertainment
1x
1x
2x
Others
1x (1.5x with Freedom Unlimited)
1x
1x

I believe CSR has the best bonus earning ratios among all three cards pre-dominantly because of its 3x points on travel (includes hotels, public transport, flights, car rentals, Uber/Lyft and more) and dining. Though CSR has one more unique feature of linking with Chase Freedom Unlimited, which gives 1.5 points on all the purchases.
AMEX Platinum has a nice 5x of Airfare and Hotels but that should be purchased directly with airlines or from the AMEX travel portal. AMEX also have a disadvantage on having $550 as their annual fee(which they changed recently).
Citi almost have the same rewards like CSR but have 2x on dining though they 2x on entertainment purchases as well.

Winner: Chase Sapphire Reserve

Runner Up: AMEX Platinum Card


Chase Sapphire Reserve.

Lets compare these bonus categories on purchases, assuming $5000 on travel, $2500 on dining, $1000 on entertainment and $10000 on other expenses.

Chase Sapphire Reserve
AMEX Platinum Card
Citi Prestige
Airfare & Hotels
15000
25000
15000
Dining
15000
5000
10000
Entertainment
1000
1000
2000
Others
15000
10000
10000
Total
46000
41000
37000

Winner: Chase Sapphire Reserve

Runner Up: AMEX Platinum Card


Citi Premier.

Sign Up Bonus, APR and Additional Card Fee

Sign up bonuses are a big factor for choosing the best cards. AMEX Platinum and Citi Prestige have always been on the slow side here. Though we sometimes see huge sign up bouses for Platinum cards but its very rare. CSR had 100,000 points offer till January 12,2017 and still has it in branch till Mar 12,2017.

Chase Sapphire Reserve
AMEX Platinum Card
Citi Prestige
Sign up Bonus
50,000 (100,000 in branch)
40,000
40,000
Additional Card Fee
16.49% to 23.49%
0 (Have to pay in full)
15.74%
Additional Card Fee
$75
$175 (for upto 3 cards)
$50

Winner: Chase Sapphire Reserve

Runner Up: AMEX Platinum Card



Annual Travel Credit and Lounge Pass

Lets compare these bonus categories on purchases, assuming $5000 on travel, $2500 on dining, $1000 on entertainment and $10000 on other expenses.

Chase Sapphire Reserve
AMEX Platinum Card
Citi Prestige
Annual Travel Credit
$300 (on any travel purchase)
$200 (Uber) + $200 (Air Travel Credit)
$250 (Air Travel Credit)
VIP Lounges Membership
Priority Pass Select
Global Lounge collection
Priority Pass Select
No. of Lounges
900+
1000+
900+
Guest Free Access
All guests in your travel party
2
2

Winner: AMEX Platinum Card

Runner Up: Chase Sapphire Reserve


The new AMEX Platinum Card with metal design.

Travel Partners

By travel partners I mean, to which airlines or hotels you can transfer your points.

Chase Sapphire Reserve
AMEX Platinum Card
Citi Prestige
British Airways
British Airways
Eva Air
Singapore Airlines
Singapore Airlines
Singapore Airlines
Flying Blue
Flying Blue
Flying Blue
Korean Air
Air Canada
Asia Miles
Southwest
ANA
Virgin America
United
Emirates
Malaysia Airlines
Virgin Atlantic
Etihad
Etihad
Hyatt
Air Mexico
Qatar Airways
IHG
Virgin America
Garuda Indonesia
Marriott
Jet Blue
Royal Orchid Plus
Ritz Carlton
Hilton
Hilton
SPG

Conclusion:

At last, it all depends on what categories you spend most. Analysing all the feautures and benefits of the three cards, I believe best high end credit card will be Chase Sapphire Reserve for regular users. Mostly because of its $300 travel credit, which brings the annual fee to almost $150. Also having Chase Freedom Unlimited with CSR will make it the best card available.
Although American Express have made some great changes to Platinum Card which brings it close enough to CSR. I also believe that Citi Prestige is far away from the race of the best as to compete with Chase and AMEX, Citi has to make some big changes to its card.

Winner: Chase Sapphire Reserve

Runner Up: AMEX Platinum Card

item.title: Chase Freedom Unlimited Offer
item.dc:creator: Devesh
item.description: Chase is running an offer on their Chase Freedom Unlimited Card in which they are offering 10% cashback on upto $2,500 in combined purchases made on hotels and car rentals through Chase Ultimate Rewards. Though the offer is valid till March 31' 2017 until 11:59 PM. I got a personal email from Chase about this offer but I don't think so this is a targeted offer.
item.content:encoded:
Chase is running an offer on their Chase Freedom Unlimited Card in which they are offering 10% cashback on upto $2,500 in combined purchases made on hotels and car rentals through Chase Ultimate Rewards. Though the offer is valid till March 31' 2017 until 11:59 PM. I got a personal email from Chase about this offer but I don't think so this is a targeted offer.

Great offer on a no annual fee card.

My Verdict:

It is a great deal as it gives us a chance to rack up around 25,000 Ultimate Rewards or $250 in cashback. However it is not easy to use the offer to the fullest unless you are planning for a trip. This offer gives a 7% extra cashback than Chase Sapphire Reserve.

item.title: Ebay Sale
item.dc:creator: Devesh
item.description: Ebay is offering discount for people effected with flood in California of 20 % off (no minimum), maximum discount of $50.
item.content:encoded:
Ebay is offering discount for people effected with flood in California.

20 % off (no minimum), maximum discount of $50.

It is a great offer, I don't know specifically which places it works in, it says it will work in flood affected areas in San Jose but it works in Sacramento aswell. It is a great offer as you can save upto $50.

20% off offer mostly for Norther California.

The deal is not for gift cards though but you can purchase many other items.
